Ethnologue > Web version > Country index > Americas > Peru > Nomatsiguenga

Nomatsiguenga

A language of Peru

ISO 639-3: not

Population  6,500 (2003 SIL). 5,500 to 6,000 monolinguals.
Region  Junín Department, between rivers Ene and Perene, Anapati River system in the foothills.
Language map  Peru, reference number 55
Alternate names   “Nomatsiguenga Campa”
Dialects  Most similar to Machiguenga [mcb].
Classification  Arawakan, Maipuran, Southern Maipuran, Pre-Andine
Language use  Official language. All ages.
Language development  Literacy rate in L1: 50%. Literacy rate in L2: 35%–40%. Videos. Dictionary. Grammar. NT: 1980.
Writing system  Latin script.
Comments  VSO. Traditional religion, Christian, syncretism.

Entries from the SIL Bibliography about this language:

Academic Publications

Nies, Joyce, compiler. 1976, 2008. Suplemento A: listas comparativas de palabras usuales en idiomas vernaculos de la selva.  

Shaver Swanson, Harold, compiler. 1976, 2008. Leyendas de los Campa Nomatsiguenga.  

Shaver, Harold and Lois Dodds. 1990. Los nomatsiguenga de la selva central.  

Shaver, Harold, compiler. 1996. Diccionario nomatsiguenga—castellano castellano—nomatsiguenga.  

Shaver, Harold. 1975. "Campa nomatsiguenga: Modificantes."  

Shaver, Harold. 1975. "Campa nomatsiguenga: Tiempos del verbo."  

Shaver, Harold. 1975. "Los campa-nomatsiguenga de la Amazonia peruana y su cosmología."

Shaver, Harold. 1982. "Funciones de la partícula cara en nomatsiguenga."  

Shaver, Harold. 1982. "Relaciones entre proposiciones en nomatsiguenga."  

Sparing, Margarethe and others. 1976, 2008. Instrumentos musicales tradicionales de varios grupos de la selva Peruana.  

Various authors. 1975. Datos Etno-Lingüísticos 11.  

Wise, Mary Ruth and Ivan Lowe. 1972. "Permutation groups in discourse."

Wise, Mary Ruth. 1968. Identification of participants in discourse: a study of aspects of form and meaning in Nomatsiguenga.

Wise, Mary Ruth. 1969. "Representación pronominal en nomatsiguenga."

Wise, Mary Ruth. 1971. Identification of participants in discourse: a study of aspects of form and meaning in Nomatsiguenga.  

Wise, Mary Ruth. 1974. "Social roles, plot roles, and focal roles in a Nomatsiguenga Campa myth."

Wise, Mary Ruth. 2002. "Applicative affixes in Peruvian Amazonian languages."

Vernacular Publications

Homenaje a la declaración universal de derechos humanos en su 40˚ aniversario 1948-1988. 1988.
